commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Thanks for coming all this way, everyone!

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: It wasn't that far, really.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: Yeah, it doesn't even take two hours to get here from Tokyo.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: And we had a bunch of fun playing games. We were here before we knew it!

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Aww, that sounds like fun! What did you play?

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Oh, just some silly card games.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: But Honoka was the only one who lost the entire trip.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: She's so easy to read since she loses focus so quickly.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: It's a shame since she's got all the luck in the world.

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: Yeah, but that's what makes her Honoka...

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Wait, what?! Is that really what you think of me, Kotori?!

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Ah, perfect timing! Looks like the bus to Uchiura is here! Let's go, girls!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Yeah!

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: So this is Uchiura, huh?

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: I can smell the ocean from here. That sea breeze feels so good.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: It's stunning... The sea is so beautiful.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: I bet it would feel so nice to just float along those waves... It'd put you right to sleep.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Don't float too far away from us, Kanata.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: It's even prettier under the water!

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: Really? I'd love to go scuba diving sometime.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: That would be nice. We probably won't be able to do it this time around, but I'd love to find the time to do it someday.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: I am SO jealous! You have the beach right in your backyard! You can go swimming whenever you want!

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Nijigasaki is near the sea as well, but it's not really somewhere people go to swim.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Swimming isn't the only way you can enjoy the beach!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: What else do you suggest?

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: All of us Aqours girls got to help out at a beach hut once. Getting to cook for and serve all those customers was a total blast!

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: That certainly does sound like fun.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Oh, looks like everyone's here. We should get a move on. This way, everyone!

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Here we are! Welcome to tonight's lodging: Tochiman!

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Wow, it's a Japanese ryokan inn! I love it!

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Come on in!

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: Though it has been many long and arduous centuries, you have done well to heed my call, little demons!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Glad to see you're doing well, Yoshiko!

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: I'm not Yoshiko! I'm Yohane!

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: All right, everyone! I know this is sudden, but I'd like you all to have a look at this.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: What is this exactly?

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: I figured we needed to get some concrete progress management on board to pull the School Idol Festival off, so I made this planning sheet.

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: I knew we could count on you!

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: We need to make some clear decisions about the delegation of responsibilities in order to get this festival running.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: To split them up into broader roles, we'll need a group to oversee general operations and overall management, a stage group to plan out the stage and create timetables...

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: ...a group to take care of snack stands and other booths, and a marketing group for promotional activities.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: There's still a lot we can't decide on since we haven't found a venue yet, but let's decide on everyone's roles to get the ball well and truly rolling.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: No objections here.

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: You've really got this covered!

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: I'm so glad we've got you, Eli! You're so perfect at everything you do!

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: What are you talking about? There's only so much I can do on my own. I'm going to need you all to pitch in and help.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: That's right. Let us all work together to make this School Idol Festival a reality!

commands.speaker: You
commands.line: Let's get those motors running! Full speed ahead! Aye, aye!

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Now I'd like everyone to start off by sharing their ideas about what kind of event you want the School Idol Festival to be.

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: What do you mean?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Hmm, well first and foremost, it's gotta be...

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: ...a kind of cultural festival created by school idols and the people who love school idols, right?

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Right, but that's a bit too vague to set as a theme for the event. I want us to have a more clear, common theme.

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: Okay, why don't we all take turns saying what we imagine the event would be like, zura?

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Oh, pick me, pick me! Can I go first?! Well, I think...
